fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37326].
  {panel}

Closed issues for an epic do not show the resolution, but this is crucial information to easily see which changes were

    done,
    deferred (i.e., will likely be fixed later),
    rejected (i.e., will not be fixed at all),
    duplicated (i.e., will be / have been fixed using a different ticket).

Take a look at the attached screenshot/mock for clarification.
!Issue Resolution in Epic.png!
Legend:
|| Icon || Resolution ||
| (-) | Rejected |
| (off) | Deferred |
| (!) | Duplicate |
| (/) | Resolved |
_empty_ Not resolved |

I know that greenhopper aka agile is responsible for the panel (issues-in-epic-panel.vm), but since I couldn't file an improvement there, I thought I'd file one with JIRA. Feel free to move this request to Agile.
fields.summary: Show issue resolution on "issues in Epic" panel

fields.description:
Case A
1. select "Confluence" from Projects menu.
2. search by JQL "project = JIRA AND status = Open"
3. open Create Issue Screen from "Create issue" button.
4. "JIRA" is selected on Create Issue Screen.

Case B
1. select "Confluence" from Projects menu.
2. search by JQL "project = JIRA AND status != Open"
3. open Create Issue Screen from "Create issue" button.
4. "Confluence" is selected on Create Issue Screen.

Expected result:  "JIRA" was selected in B-4.
Actual Result: "Confluence" is selected.

Observation: Based on = or != operator, the automatic project section behaves differently
fields.summary: In create issue screen, automatic project selection behaves differently based on JQL match operator

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Javascript doesn't load in issue create screen, when the custom field is configured to one specific issue type scheme, and it is not the default issue type.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a custom field, add javascript into the description. 
# Copy the Default Screen
# Create a new Screen Scheme, and associate it to the Copy the Default Screen
# Create new Issue Type Scheme, add all issue types
# Create a new project (Project A)
# Associate the new Screen Scheme and Issue Type Scheme
# Configure custom field, add context so that it is assigned to one issue type in Project A
# Make sure the issue type assigned is not the default issue type in step 4
# Go to Dashboard, create new issue
# Choose the issue type where the custom field is added
fields.summary: Javascript fails to load when added as description for non-default issue type

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When clicking on tabs in a view issue screen, the footer slides up from the bottom of the screen until it hits the content. This happens every time you change a tab and either the content doesn't fill the screen, or the content takes a while to load.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new issue
# Switch tabs in the view issue screen

alternatively... just switch tabs on this issue to see it happen
fields.summary: Footer slides up from bottom of screen until it hits content when switching tabs

fields.summary: Jira Comments: Using "star" to format text as bold is not working after the latest update to JIRA v6.2-OD-10-004-WN

fields.description:
When one goes to delete a task, the following warning is displayed: 
{quote}
Please confirm that you wish to delete this issue.

Deleting an issue removes it permanently from JIRA, including all of its comments and attachments.

If you have completed the issue, it should usually be resolved or closed - not deleted.
{quote}

Subtasks are not mentioned here -- Jira will delete all subtasks of this task.  The expectation of some users, however, are that the subtasks will be kept, but orphaned.  Could you please change this message to make it clear subtasks will also be deleted?
fields.summary: Please add 'sub-tasks' to the warning about deleting tasks from Jira

fields.description: As of JIRA 6.2, it is now mandatory to enter at least one Option when creating a customfield that implements options. It is a wrong assumption that a user is required to enter options in a customfield. Any customfield that derives from AbstractMultiCFType and that implements options does not necessarily have to have options. It is the case of the Checklist add-on on the marketplace. By being mandatory, a user of Checklist that only needs to enter value at the issue level has to enter a dummy option and remove it later. This is not very user friendly.
fields.summary: A Multiple CustomField Type should not enforce entering Options

fields.description:
There is no spacing between the icon and the text in the activity stream.
Please refer to the attached screenshot with JIRA 6.2 (affected) and JIRA 6.1.7 (not affected).
Environment details:
JIRA 6.2
Firefox 27.0.1

This issue does not happen in Safari nor in Chrome.
fields.summary: There is no spacing between the icon and the text in the activity stream.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37300].
  {panel}

When attempting to move a subtask from one parent to another, the drop down menu in the parent issue field does not show an ellipsis.
This cuts off the summary of the issues displayed in the drop down, making it hard to determine which parent issue to choose if the summary is longer than the field permits to get displayed.

In a similar situation under the link issue section, the ellipsis is present and the whole summary is properly readable.

Steps to reproduce:
# Open a sub-task
# Choose "Move" from the More options
# Choose "Change Parent" from the "Choose Operation" page
# On the next page, start typing in the parent issue field in order for the drop down menu to show up
fields.summary: Issue summary on sub-task parent move not showing ellipsis

# Add a <label></label> html tag to your edit template

# Once the custom field has been saved, return to inline edit mode. The label tag has been removed.

This cause major issues to my marketplace custom field as items are being lost/deleted.
fields.summary: Label html tag stripped from inline edit template in customfield

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

* User is unable to map sub-task specific statuses on JIRA Agile boards when the board query involves the {{parent}} clause.
* JIRA Issue Navigator columns may not allow fields which are sub-task specific if the {{parent}} clause is used.

h3. Technical explanation

The "query context" of a clause is which projects/issue types may be returned by the clause.

For the JQL clause {{parent}} this is currently being calculated incorrectly as the context of the parent issues specified. Instead it should be the context of the parent's sub-tasks.

This is evidenced in JIRA Agile when the {{parent}} clause is used in the query for a board. The board calculates the query context to determine which statuses it should display. When a {{parent}} clause is used, only the statuses for the parent are shown, not the sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Clause Context for JQL clause 'parent' is calculated incorrectly

fields.description:
When I (and others) create a new project in JIRA, we get a Permission Violation error (see the attached screenshot). It's been happening the past couple of versions--since around November of 2013. 

When this first happened I checked my permissions--I'm an administrator --but was given system administration permissions and I still got the error. When I went to create that project again--it said that name and ID code was already in use. After logging out and in a few times, the project finally appeared and I could apply permissions, notifications, etc. 

We are running 6.1. We can't figure out what is happening. I've searched your support area and find nothing--looking at the user/ permission area of your documentation has not helped. We should be fine!

We want to upgrade to 6.2 but when we took a look at it in our dev environment we cannot successfully create a project at all. Still get the permissions violation--but no project ever, ever gets created. Though it won't let me use that project name/id. I fear that we'll lose the ability to successfully create a project if we put 6.2 into production and I know there's security vulnerability fix. The permission violation has been a pain (and haven't had a chance to raise the issue--until now) but at least the project eventually showed up.

I have a sys admin dwagley@keymind.com who maintains the server/db,etc. 

We are running Java 1.7.0_25
postgres72 8.4.20
OS: Linux 2.6.32-431.5.1.e16x86_64
Apache Tomcat/7.0.29
JIRA: 6.1.1.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Since JIRA 5.x, get a permissions violation when creating a project

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with any user as the Lead
# Rename the username for the project Lead
# Go to project administration and click Edit Project
# Add some descirption for project
# Click Update

h3. Expected Results
Project is updated

h3. Actual Results
# Nothing happens, no error messages as well.
# Nothing in logs

h3. Workaround
# Change the Project Lead to an user who has not been renamed
# Make the Project Edits
# Revert Project Lead back to original user

Note: it's not possible to determine if an user had been renamed in JIRA's interface, but you can check via the database table *app_user*.  If the *user_key* does not match *lower_user_name*, then the username had been changed.
fields.summary: Regression - Project Edit Is Broken If Project Lead Is A Renamed User

I am using IntelliJ 13 with the Atlassian Connector version 3.0.13, SVN: 1312051023 and JIRA 6.1.3.
I can connect to our JIRA-Server, see and change issues.
When trying to *create a new issue*, I'm getting *"Error while fetching security levels"*. (We do use Issue Security.)

Searching google I have found this issue commited by [~jgorycki]:
{quote}
Janusz Gorycki committed 2013-06-04 (raw commit)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37268].
  {panel}

One of our clients asked us to debug some weird behaviour on Chrome browser, so we did, over the wire. They say the behaviour is erratic (i.e. some have it, some don't).
Links to the original issues (requires creation of an account):

http://bugs.kepler-rominfo.com/browse/KBA-21
http://bugs.kepler-rominfo.com/browse/KBA-22

Env: poor network conditions(!), Chrome latest (Chrome 33.0.1750117M), *JIRA in safe mode* ( i.e. no plugins enabled).

Problem: Besides it's slow to load (which is understandable), Chrome time-outs on some resources, randomly picked, and everything will blow up, eventually. F5+F5 in the browser, page remains blank.
It is worth to note that sometimes the pages were loaded very fast, sometimes very slow if at all.

Puzzling: FF and IE do not have the same behaviour, even for those poor network conditions. They act slow, but the resources (js, images, etc) are loaded, eventually.

I sincerely do not believe this is a JIRA problem, but rather a Chrome one, however it should be investigated and reported, if it is confirmed, to the Chromium team.
fields.summary: Chrome fails to load pages / acting slow

h3. Issue Summary
Basically, this behaviour is actually similar the following report (which I believe it is actually a regression from the previous JIRA itself):
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25505
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-21586

h3. Steps to reproduce this behaviour:
# Right click on the create issue button and then select *open link in new tab*
# From there try to fill up all the required field
# Click on the *Create* button multiple times

h3. Expected results:
It is possible to create one issue only.

Multiple duplicate issues created with the same Summary field being created.

h3. Notes:
When you click directly on the create issue button, the create issue form will appear in a popup form and this problem is not reproducible. It will only happen if you open it in a new tab in the internet browser itself.

h3. Workaround:
Use the standard way to create users (clicking normally on the create button instead of opening in a tab).

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In support from time to time, we get users who have renewed a plugin license key, contact us about trouble updating the license key, or guidiance finding where to put the new license key. Below is a screenshot of what the plugin details screen where the license key is updated in the UPM looks like:
!license.png|width=100%!

Example of feedback we got from 2 customers recently is:
bq. I actually checked that screen like ten times for a way to enter the new license but always overlooked that pencil button. It might make sense to provide a direct link to the license setting when a license did expire.

bq. Manually installing the licence did work. But finding the Pen Button besides the licence key was not easy

h3. Suggested Solution
Updating the license key is not something that people have to do often, it's perhaps understandable that it's a bit out of sight. However, perhaps we can create a more intuitive way to update plugin license keys, especially after a plugin license has expired? Perhaps a notification that logged in Admins can see, which when clicked, pops up a field to paste-in  the license key directly. This could then automatically direct the user to the updated plugin screen page as a confirmation.
fields.summary: Improve visibility for where to update plugin license key

{panel}
h3. +Base_URL/status+

Currently it's possible to check Application Status for JIRA, Confluence, and Bitbucket (formerly Stash) using {{Base_URL/status}} e.g.:
 * [http://jira.domain.com/status]
 * [http://confluence.domain.com/status]
 * [http://bitbucket.domain.com/status]

(i) The output should look like _\{"state":"RUNNING"}_ (this varies depending on actual status).

However, the */status* path is not available for other Atlassian Apps e.g. Bamboo, Crowd, and Fisheye/Crucible (_as of July 2017_).

(!) This may be related to the fact that */status* is meant for Data Center, which is originally available for JIRA, Confluence, and Bitbucket only.
h3. +serverInfo REST Endpoint+

In JIRA there's a *serverInfo* REST Endpoint that can be used to query the status of JIRA application:
 * [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/serverInfo]

This endpoint is able to *doHealthCheck* as well, however it's not available for the other products.
h3. +Suggestion+

(+) It would be great to have these checks available which would help with automated availability checking.
fields.summary: Ability to check Application Status using Base_URL/status and serverInfo REST Endpoint

fields.description:
If a user that has an non-deliverable email address/account is a watcher for an issue, updating that issue will trigger an infinite loop of failure emails being converted to issue comments.

1- create a mail handler to create and update issues
2- set a user with a bad email address or other problem as a watcher to an issue or in notification scheme.
3 - update the issue

The email server replies with a reject notification. The rejection notice email is treated like an update to the issue, which in turn creates another email notification that the issue was updated. The bad account is notified again which repeats until the user is removed as a watcher from all issues or the email account/address is corrected/able to accept mail again.  If this goes unnoticed, hundreds of updates are added to an issue.
This is from an MS Exchange Mail Server:
David Weiss added a comment - Yesterday 10:18 PM:
Delivery has failed to these recipients or distribution lists:
<bad email address>
The recipient's e-mail address was not found in the recipient's e-mail system. Microsoft Exchange will not try to redeliver this message for you. Please check the e-mail address and try resending this message, or provide the following diagnostic text to your system administrator.

This could also happen on inbox full with mail servers that reject each message regardless of the sender being notified once already.
The system also updates issues with out of office replies, but mail servers only send one reply per sender.  That's considered a minor irritant but worth mentioning.
fields.summary: Infinite comment notification loop when email delivery fails

fields.description:
Dear all
we have upgraded from JIRA 4.4.5 to JIRA 6.1.7 today. After that, we have recognized that there are problems with message custom fields (for view and edit):
we use this type of field for displaying our own workflow-figures via having an html script as standard value of the particular field with links to the corresponding figure.

Some (but not all) of the existing fields are kind of broken now. We cannot save any value in this field any more and the old standard values have disappeared.
Within one field, it also happens that one of the existing context is affected and anotherone not.
The biggest problem is that we even cannot save any value for this fields any more, JIRA simply does not save the value, but without any error message.
MEans we even vannot restore the fields from backup data. I would need to create all fields from scratch as it seems that new fields (created within JIRA 6.1.7) are not affected.

This happens on all migrated systems (test system and production) means is reproducable for us.

We cannot switch to JIRA 6.2 as this migration has a lot of plugin-dependencies and is quite a lot of work for us. We need a fix for 6.1.7...

thanks for your help, this is really quite urgent for us as we are having lots of different projects within JIRA (approx 300) which means a lot of different workflow-fields (message custom fields).

best regards

Birgit Greiffenberg
fields.summary: problem with message custom fields

fields.description:
The table cwd_directory_attribute contains connection parameters for user directories. Now, if one enters the following string for attribute name "ldap.url", you obtain the desirable result that users can be authenticated against the secondary LDAP server in case the primary LDAP server is not available (confirmed via authentication tests):

"ldaps://<primary_ldap_dns>:<ldap_port> ldaps://<secondary_ldap_dns>:<ldap_port>"

However, if you attempted to update the URLs via the Web UI, you reach an error page with the following explanation:

Cause
Referer URL: https://<jira_host>/jira/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/list
Request processing failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.FatalBeanException: Could not copy properties from source to target; nested exception is java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

And the following info in catalina.out:

Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "<ldap_port> ldaps://<secondary_ldap_dns>:<ldap_port>"

Apparently, this admin page is incapable of handling multiple servers. I tried different syntaces - to no avail. Btw, we have custom ldap ports, so leaving <ldap_port> off after the <primary_ldap_dns> is not an option.

NB: To duplicate this you need to have an admin user in a local directory and regular users in a directory withe delegated authentication.
fields.summary: Multiple LDAP servers cannot be administered via the Web UI

fields.description:
Context batch mechanism does not honour the 4095-rules CSS limit when building batches. As a result, it cannot be relied upon. Example: have the following resource in {{atlassian-plugin.xml}} {code} jira.webresources:jira-global jira.webresources:global-static jira.webresources:jira-fields jira.webresources:set-focus com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:common-lite {code} and the following gadget spec: {code} #requireContext("com.acme.foo:test-gadget-resources") #includeResources()

This is a test gadget.

]]> {code} Add the gadget, view source. Observe: there is only one batch file containing all the CSS. Expected: several files, each containing not more than 4095 rules.
fields.summary: Context batches in Gadgets do not work with Internet Explorer 8-9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37201].
  {panel}

It is a problem that the import of data requires 'JIRA Administrators global permission'

If someone wishes to migrate from other systems to JIRA Agile their first thought would be 'How do I import data from my current backlog to JIRA.'

When I started out with the role as Lead I expected by intuition the import feature under the systems menu in administration of the project to be available to me. However it was not and I have now discovered that the import not only changes the project that I wish to Import to but potentially could damage other projects...

I suggest giving access to the import feature per default to project leads, because it is necessary to get an easy import and that it will be more convincing in regard of moving teams from other platforms to JIRA. When migrating, the import experience is the thing that could scare people away (make it or break it) from the platform if it is to tiresome/complex.

Also change the import to be isolated to the current project so that other projects still are 'safe' when doing imports would be a good idea.
fields.summary: Simplify Complicated Access to Import of CSV Data to Agile Boards

fields.description:
Using the "Log Work" option raises a dialog. In this dialog you can log a period selecting the "Period" check box. If you also checks "Log another" checkbox and then click "Log Work", the dialog appears again, clean, to log another work with the "Period" checkbox checked but with the rest of the interface to input only one day, not a period, which yields to a period validation error when you click again "Log Work".

Steps:
-Click Log Work (the dialog appears).
-Click "Period" checkbox (the interface changes to log a period).
-Input the period and time.
-Click "Log Another".
-Click "Log Work" button (the dialog reloads as explained).

Additional information:
-Web broser version: Firefox 27.0.1
-OS: Microsoft Windows XP Service Pack 3
fields.summary: Log Work dialog does not preserve the value of the "Period" when using "Log another"

fields.description:
A large number of custom fields has historically caused performance problems due to how we implemented custom field sorting. See JRA-25721.

However, it seems like things have deteriorated further in the recent releases. From an initial investigation with [~tcampbell], it seems the origin of the recent degradation was the changes to support custom field name translations in JIRA 6.1.
fields.summary: Recent performance degradation in Custom Field Sorting
